title: How to have your benefits paid

details.description: Benefit payments to a bank account or post office card account or direct payments
details.alternative_title: Benefit payments and bank and post office card accounts
details.body:
Benefits are usually paid straight into your bank, building society or credit union account - if you donâ€™t have one you can also get paid using a Post Office card account.

Post Office card account

These accounts are specifically designed for you to receive benefits, state pension and tax credits.

No other income can be paid into your Post Office card account, eg your salary.

Opening a Post Office card account

To open an account you’ll need:

  • to contact the office that pays your benefit, either the Department for Work and Pensions (DWP) or HM Revenue & Customs (HMRC)
  • proof of identity, eg a passport
  • proof of where you’re living, eg a recent bill with your name and address on it

If you don’t have a bank or Post Office card account

Payments can still be made by cheque but these are gradually being phased out.

If you can’t have your benefits paid into an account, contact the HMRC Benefit Enquiry Line or the DWP as there may be alternatives.
